answers.answer: Hi my dad is diabetic tpye 2 only needs to take 3 tablets a day he is dieing of prostate cancer so l dont know weather being diabetic helps to ward of cancer or not
thx for answering   was just curious  I am type 2 also and take just 1 a day. Sorry to hear about your Father.

Hi Simplystar. My mother is diabetic. She got it in her 60s. She gives herself insulin shots. My father as I mentioned before--was a cropduster years ago with DDT. He remembers the powder all over himself.Yes these are things that can manifest as DNA mutations. I know the research is endless. I have a file cabinet full of stuff. My memory is not so good to keep up with it all. Keep doing your good research. Heh maybe diabetes does in some way have something to do with another variable. I've always had hypoglycemic problems. Can't drink more than a glass of wine or consume too much sugar or it would mess up my whole day.

question: I have read alot about Insulin tharapy for Cancer and I am wondering if a study has even been made to see if diabetics on Insulin or the pills, have fewer incedents of Ca?? Also I read of some chemo treatments include an injection of insulin. The cancer cells has many inceptor points?? It aides the chemo drug to infiltrate the Ca cell better. I would like info if any of you have heard or used this. I am a diabetic, goes back many generations on my side of the family. None of these ladies to my knowledge ever had cancer of any kind. My 3 brothers all were diabetic also and none of them ever develored Ca. Makes me wonder. Can't keep my mind from working on research. My daughter was tested for diabetus and it was not present at the time of her dx. But then I am finding that her Dad's radiation in WW2 might have caused a genetic mutation  and thus the Ca.
title: Wondering about Diabetus and Cancer
